clusterList.phrase: we found a disproportionately high association between living close to a highway and birth complications among affluent mothers

among affluent mothers who live within 200 metres of a highway the odds of delivering an infant with low birth weight increase by 81 percent while their odds of delivering a preterm baby increase by 58 percent compared to mothers who don't live anywhere close to expressways
advantaged mothers may be more susceptible to highway pollution possibly because they have been protected from other hazards present in low income neighbourhoods
a greater percentage of u s children is being born into adverse environments
